test_message: Persistent joint pain in knees and wrists, morning stiffness, swelling
expected_purpose: Sub-agent - Maps symptoms to appropriate medical specialist

primary_specialist.reason: The symptoms of persistent joint pain in knees and wrists, morning stiffness, and swelling suggest possible inflammatory or autoimmune conditions such as arthritis.

secondary_specialists.reason: Orthopedics may help evaluate the structural aspects of the joints and address any mechanical issues contributing to the pain.
To coordinate overall care and manage any general health concerns related to the symptoms.

result.routing_summary: Persistent joint pain and swelling alongside morning stiffness are indicative of potential rheumatologic conditions, warranting a primary consultation with a rheumatologist. Orthopedic and primary care specialists can provide further support and management.
